intro: Dicarpellum pancheri, commonly known as the Pancheri dicarpellum, is a rare and little-studied plant species. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant is native to specific regions in South Asia, where it thrives in moist, temperate climates. Its botanical features include finely divided leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
